intro: Ligusticum californicum, commonly known as California wild chervil, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It is often found in California and Oregon, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a notable species in native plant gardens.
